The 'University Transition Program', often called the 'Transition
Program', is an early college entrance program funded by the Vancouver
School Board, the University of British Columbia and the BC Ministry of
Education that is based in the University of British Columbia in
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. Each year, the program accepts only
20 new students between the ages 13 to 15, half of which are from outside
the Vancouver School District, out of about 200 applicants, so rigorous
testing must be performed to select and accept candidates. Vancouver
School Board|url=http://www.vsb.bc.ca/programs/university-transition-
program|work=Mini Schools|publisher=Vancouver School Board|accessdate=12
January 2012}} Over the course of two years, students aim to
complete the required high school curriculum, along with some university
level coursework. When they graduate from the program, the students
usually are accepted into UBC earlier than they would if they graduated
from a regular high school (aged 15â17 instead of 17â18). The program was
first established in 1993 by the Vancouver School Board, British Columbia
Ministry of Education and the University of British Columbia.
University Transition Program|url=http://universitytransition.ubc.ca|pub-
lisher=UBC|accessdate=12 January 2012}} Students of the program
have access to most UBC facilities and possess UBC undergraduate student
cards.[http://universitytransition.ubc.ca/content/welcome-0]
